definitions: photographic film containing miniaturized images of documents for storage and reference
examples: The library archives old newspapers on microfilm for preservation
Researchers use microfilm readers to view historical documents

definitions: instrument for making extremely accurate measurements of small distances or thicknesses
examples: The engineer used a micrometer to measure the wire thickness
Quality control requires micrometer precision for these parts

definitions: metric unit of length equal to one millionth of a meter
examples: The filter removes particles larger than five microns
Human hair typically measures about seventy microns in diameter

definitions: tiny living organism visible only through a microscope, including bacteria and viruses
examples: Scientists study microorganisms to understand disease transmission patterns
Beneficial microorganisms help break down organic matter in soil

definitions: device that converts sound waves into electrical signals for recording or amplification
examples: The singer adjusted the microphone before starting the performance
Conference rooms need quality microphones for clear communication

definitions: integrated circuit containing the complete central processing unit of a computer on a single chip
examples: Modern smartphones contain powerful microprocessors for complex computations
The microprocessor revolutionized personal computing in the 1970s

definitions: optical instrument using lenses to produce magnified images of small objects
examples: Students examined plant cells under the microscope in biology class
The laboratory microscope revealed bacteria invisible to naked eyes

definitions: technical field involving the use of microscopes to study objects too small for naked eye observation
examples: Electron microscopy provides incredibly detailed images of cell structures
Advanced microscopy techniques revolutionized our understanding of biology

definitions: oven that heats food using electromagnetic radiation
form of electromagnetic radiation with wavelengths between radio and infrared
examples: She reheated leftover pizza in the microwave oven
The microwave beeped when the popcorn finished cooking
Satellite communications use microwave frequencies for data transmission
Microwave radiation can penetrate clouds better than visible light

definitions: point or area in the air between the ground and sky
examples: The acrobat caught her partner in midair during the performance
Birds can change direction in midair with remarkable agility

definitions: portion of the brainstem between the forebrain and hindbrain controlling vision and hearing
examples: The midbrain processes visual and auditory reflexes automatically
Damage to the midbrain can affect motor control functions

definitions: middle of the day when the sun reaches its highest point
examples: Workers took their lunch break at midday as usual
The midday sun cast short shadows on the ground

definitions: person who buys from producers and sells to retailers or consumers
examples: Farmers sell directly to consumers to avoid middleman fees
The middleman negotiated prices between manufacturers and stores

definitions: boxer or wrestling competitor weighing between light heavyweight and welterweight divisions
examples: The middleweight champion defended his title successfully last night
She competed in the middleweight division throughout her career

definitions: products or materials of medium grade between the best and worst quality
examples: The merchant sorted cotton into premium and middling grades
They sold middling quality furniture at reasonable prices

definitions: central area of a sports field between the two goals or end zones
examples: The team controlled midfield throughout the entire match yesterday
Players battled for possession in midfield during overtime

definitions: tiny two-winged fly often found in swarms near water
examples: Clouds of midges hovered above the lake at sunset
The camping trip was plagued by midges and mosquitoes

definitions: person of unusually small stature due to medical condition
something much smaller than usual size for its type
examples: The medical term replaced midget with more respectful language
Some circuses historically featured midget performers in their shows
They raced midget cars at the local speedway track
The company produced midget submarines for special operations

definitions: middle part of a country away from the coasts
examples: Industries flourished in the midland regions during industrialization
The midland dialect differs from coastal speech patterns

definitions: imaginary line dividing something into equal left and right halves
examples: Surgeons made an incision along the abdominal midline carefully
The midline of the road separated opposing traffic lanes

definitions: exact center point between two ends or extremes of something
examples: We met at the midpoint between our two cities
Calculate the midpoint of the line segment using coordinates

definitions: main vein running through the center of a leaf from base to tip
examples: The midrib provides structural support for the entire leaf
Botanists examine the midrib pattern to identify plant species

definitions: middle portion of something, especially the torso between chest and hips
examples: Athletes strengthen their midsection with core exercise routines
The ship broke apart at the midsection during storms

definitions: officer cadet training to become a commissioned naval officer
examples: The midshipman studied navigation at the naval academy
Midshipmen serve aboard ships during their training cruises

definitions: middle part of a river or the middle of any ongoing process
examples: The canoe capsized in midstream during rapid waters
Changing strategies midstream can disrupt project progress significantly

definitions: middle part of summer, especially around the summer solstice
examples: The midsummer festival celebrates the longest day of year
Gardens bloom magnificently during midsummer in temperate climates

definitions: examination given in the middle of an academic term
middle point of an elected official's term in office
examples: Students studied intensively for their midterm examinations this week
The professor scheduled midterm exams before spring break
Voters expressed dissatisfaction during the midterm elections last November
Presidential approval often drops during midterm election cycles

definitions: point or place at equal distance between two locations
area at a fair with games and amusement rides
examples: We stopped for lunch midway through our journey
The rest area sits midway between the two cities
Children enjoyed rides and games along the carnival midway
The midway featured cotton candy and prize booths

definitions: middle of the week, typically Tuesday through Thursday
examples: Business meetings often occur during midweek for better attendance
Midweek flights usually cost less than weekend travel

definitions: trained professional who assists women during childbirth and provides prenatal care
examples: The midwife monitored the mother throughout labor and delivery
Many women choose midwives for more personalized birthing experiences

definitions: professional practice of assisting women during pregnancy, childbirth, and postpartum period
examples: She studied midwifery to help women have safer births
Modern midwifery combines traditional knowledge with medical training

definitions: middle part of winter, especially around the winter solstice
examples: The midwinter festival brought warmth to cold dark days
Animals conserve energy during the harsh midwinter months

definitions: person's appearance or manner that shows their character or mood
examples: His confident mien impressed everyone at the interview
The queen maintained a regal mien throughout the ceremony

definitions: intense recurring headache often accompanied by nausea and sensitivity to light
examples: She retreated to a dark room during her migraine
Certain foods can trigger migraine attacks in sensitive individuals

definitions: person who moves from one place to another for work or better living conditions
examples: Migrant workers harvest crops across different regions seasonally
The migrant family sought better opportunities in the city

definitions: semicircular niche in mosque wall indicating the direction of Mecca for prayer
examples: Worshippers face the mihrab during their daily prayers
The mihrab features beautiful calligraphy and geometric designs

definitions: historical title for the emperor of Japan in Western usage
examples: The mikado ruled Japan during the Meiji restoration period
Western writers often used mikado when referring to Japanese emperors

definitions: informal shortened form of microphone used in audio recording
examples: The sound engineer adjusted the mike levels before recording
Please speak directly into the mike for better clarity

definitions: unit of measurement equal to one thousandth of an inch
examples: The plastic sheeting measured ten mils in thickness
Engineers specified wire diameter in mils for precision

definitions: thin fungus that grows on damp surfaces appearing as discolored patches
examples: Bathroom tiles developed mildew from constant moisture exposure
Regular cleaning prevents mildew growth on shower curtains

definitions: number of miles traveled or distance a vehicle can travel per gallon
amount of use or benefit gained from something
examples: The car's mileage decreased after years of driving
Check the odometer for accurate mileage before buying
Politicians get considerable mileage from popular policy proposals
She got good mileage from that joke at parties

definitions: marker beside a road showing the distance in miles from a given point
examples: Drivers check mileposts to track their highway progress
Emergency crews use mileposts to locate accident scenes quickly

definitions: athlete who specializes in running one-mile races
examples: The miler broke the school record by two seconds
Professional milers train specifically for middle-distance racing events

definitions: significant event marking important progress or development
stone marker showing distance in miles along a road
examples: Graduating college was a major milestone in her life
The project reached an important milestone with prototype completion
Ancient Roman roads featured milestones every thousand paces
Historic milestones still mark distances on old highways

definitions: social environment or cultural context in which something exists or develops
examples: Artists thrived in the creative milieu of 1920s Paris
The corporate milieu shaped her professional communication style

definitions: aggressive support for a cause using confrontational or violent methods
examples: The group's militancy alienated potential supporters of their cause
Labor militancy increased during periods of economic hardship

definitions: person who uses confrontational or violent methods to support a cause
examples: Militants disrupted the peaceful protest with aggressive tactics
The militant demanded immediate action on climate change

definitions: belief that a country should maintain strong military capability and use it aggressively
examples: Militarism contributed to tensions leading to World War I
Critics argue that militarism diverts resources from social programs

definitions: person who believes in building up military strength and using it to achieve national goals
examples: The militarist argued for increased defense spending annually
Militarists dominated the government during the pre-war period

definitions: process of organizing society for military conflict or giving military character to civilian institutions
examples: The militarization of police forces concerns civil rights advocates
Border militarization increased tensions between neighboring countries significantly
